Package fr.istic.cartaylor.api

Interface PropertyManager

All Known Subinterfaces:
Part
All Known Implementing Classes:
ConfigurationTest.AA, ConfigurationTest.AB, ConfigurationTest.BA, ConfigurationTest.BB, PartImpl, PartTest.ConcretePart
public interface PropertyManager
A public type to manages properties for a part.
Author:
plouzeau

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    java.util.Set<java.lang.String> getAvailablePropertyValues​(java.lang.String propertyName)
    Returns an immutable set of discrete string values for a given property.
    java.util.Optional<java.lang.String> getProperty​(java.lang.String propertyName)
    Returns the optional value of a property.
    java.util.Set<java.lang.String> getPropertyNames()
    Returns an immutable set of the property names supported by the property manager.
    void setProperty​(java.lang.String propertyName, java.lang.String propertyValue)
    Sets the value of a given property.

  • Method Details

    • getPropertyNames

      java.util.Set<java.lang.String> getPropertyNames()
      Returns an immutable set of the property names supported by the property manager.
      Returns:
      Immutable set of property names

    • getAvailablePropertyValues

      java.util.Set<java.lang.String> getAvailablePropertyValues​(java.lang.String propertyName)
      Returns an immutable set of discrete string values for a given property. For properties that have a non explicit set of possible values (eg double converted to strings), or for a non existing property name, returns an empty set.
      Parameters:
      propertyName - a non-null string reference
      Returns:
      an immutable set (see above)

    • getProperty

      java.util.Optional<java.lang.String> getProperty​(java.lang.String propertyName)
      Returns the optional value of a property. If the object does not support that property then an empty optional is returned.
      Parameters:
      propertyName - the property to read
      Returns:
      On optional storing the value set for property, or an empty optional if the property is not supported

    • setProperty

      void setProperty​(java.lang.String propertyName, java.lang.String propertyValue)
      Sets the value of a given property. If there is not such property, or if it not writable, or if the value is invalid then an IllegalArgumentException is thrown.
      Parameters:
      propertyName - Name of the property
      propertyValue - Value of the property
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - (see above)
